items.title: Awesome Terraform
items.content_text:
### Tools / Community providers

*   [inframap (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/cycloidio/inframap) - Read your tfstate or HCL to generate a graph specific for each provider, showing only the resources that are most important/relevant.
*   [terracognita (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/cycloidio/terracognita) - Reads from existing Cloud Providers (reverse Terraform) and generates your infrastructure as code on Terraform configuration.
*   [terracost (‚≠ê323)](https://github.com/cycloidio/terracost) - Cloud cost estimation for Terraform in your CLI.
*   [terradozer (‚≠ê166)](https://github.com/jckuester/terradozer) - Terraform destroy without configuration files.
*   [tfcmt (‚≠ê467)](https://github.com/suzuki-shunsuke/tfcmt) - CLI to notify the result of plan and apply as Pull Request comment.
items.content_html:
Tools / Community providers

  • inframap (‚≠ê1.9k) - Read your tfstate or HCL to generate a graph specific for each provider, showing only the resources that are most important/relevant.
  • terracognita (‚≠ê2.3k) - Reads from existing Cloud Providers (reverse Terraform) and generates your infrastructure as code on Terraform configuration.
  • terracost (‚≠ê323) - Cloud cost estimation for Terraform in your CLI.
  • terradozer (‚≠ê166) - Terraform destroy without configuration files.
  • tfcmt (‚≠ê467) - CLI to notify the result of plan and apply as Pull Request comment.

items.title: Awesome Graphql
items.content_text:
### Specifications

*   [GraphQL (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-spec) - Working draft of the specification for GraphQL.
*   [GraphQL over HTTP (‚≠ê414)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-over-http) - Working draft of "GraphQL over HTTP" specification.
*   [GraphQL Relay](https://relay.dev/docs/guides/graphql-server-specification/) - Relay-compliant GraphQL server specification.
*   [OpenCRUD (‚≠ê388)](https://github.com/opencrud/opencrud) - OpenCRUD is a GraphQL CRUD API specification for databases.
*   [Apollo Federation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/federation-spec/) - Apollo Federation specification

### Foundations

*   [GraphQL Foundation](https://graphql.org/foundation/) - GraphQL Foundation under the Linux Foundation

### Communities

*   [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/groups/795330550572866/) - Group for discussions, articles and knowledge sharing.
*   [StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/graphql) - Questions and answers. Use the tag `graphql`.
*   [GraphQL APIs (‚≠ê4.6k)](https://github.com/APIs-guru/graphql-apis) - A collective list of public GraphQL APIs.

### Meetups

*   [Relay Meetup](https://relaymeetup.com/) - A global, online meetup on Relay, the GraphQL client.
*   [Amsterdam](https://www.meetup.com/Amsterdam-GraphQL-Meetup/)
*   [Bangalore](https://www.meetup.com/graphql-bangalore/)
*   [Berlin](https://www.meetup.com/graphql-berlin/)
*   [Buenos Aires](https://www.meetup.com/es-ES/GraphQL-BA/)
*   [Copenhagen](https://www.meetup.com/Copenhagen-GraphQL-Meetup-Group/)
*   [Dallas-Fort Worth](https://www.meetup.com/DFW-GraphQL-Meetup/)
*   [Hamburg](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Hamburg/)
*   [London](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-London/)
*   [Melbourne](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Melbourne/)
*   [Munich](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Munich/)
*   [New York City](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-NYC/)
*   [San Francisco](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-SF/)
*   [Seattle](https://www.meetup.com/Seattle-GraphQL/)
*   [Sydney](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Sydney/)
*   [Tel Aviv](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-TLV/)
*   [Wroc≈Çaw](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Wroclaw/)
*   [Singapore](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-SG/)
*   [Zurich](https://www.meetup.com/GraphQL-Zurich/)

### JavaScript/TypeScript

*   [graphql-js (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js) - A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript.
*   [graphql-jit (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/zalando-incubator/graphql-jit) - GraphQL execution using a JIT compiler.

### Clients

*   [apollo-client (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-client) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for every UI framework and GraphQL server.
*   [graphql-request (‚≠ê6k)](https://github.com/prisma-labs/graphql-request) - A minimal GraphQL client for Node and browsers.
*   [typescript-graphql-request](https://graphql-code-generator.com/docs/plugins/typescript-graphql-request) - Use GraphQL Request as a fully typed SDK.
*   [graphql-zeus (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/graphql-editor/graphql-zeus) - GraphQL Zeus creates autocomplete client library for `JavaScript` or `TypeScript` which provides autocompletion for strongly typed queries.
*   [graphqurl (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/hasura/graphqurl) - curl for GraphQL with autocomplete, subscriptions and GraphiQL. Also a dead-simple universal javascript GraphQL client.
*   [aws-amplify (‚≠ê9.5k)](https://github.com/aws-amplify/amplify-js) - A client library developed by Amazon for caching, analytics and more that includes a way to fetch GraphQL queries.

### Frontend Framework Integrations

*   [vue-apollo (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-apollo) - Apollo/GraphQL integration for VueJS.
*   [apollo-angular (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/apollo-angular) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for Angular and every GraphQL server.
*   [svelte-apollo (‚≠ê949)](https://github.com/timhall/svelte-apollo) - Svelte integration for Apollo GraphQL.
*   [ember-apollo-client (‚≠ê280)](https://github.com/ember-graphql/ember-apollo-client) - An ember-cli addon for Apollo Client and GraphQL.
*   [apollo-elements (‚≠ê420)](https://github.com/apollo-elements/apollo-elements) - GraphQL web components that work in any frontend framework.

### Frontend Framework Integrations / React

*   [react-apollo](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/) - The core @apollo/client library provides built-in integration with React.
*   [relay (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/facebook/relay) - Relay is a JavaScript framework for building data-driven React applications.
*   [urql (‚≠ê8.8k)](https://github.com/FormidableLabs/urql) - A simple caching GraphQL client for React.
*   [graphql-hooks (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/nearform/graphql-hooks) - Minimal hooks-first GraphQL client with caching and server-side rendering support.
*   [mst-gql (‚≠ê688)](https://github.com/mobxjs/mst-gql) - Bindings for mobx-state-tree and GraphQL.
*   [micro-graphql-react (‚≠ê532)](https://github.com/arackaf/micro-graphql-react) - A lightweight utility for adding GraphQL to React. components. Includes simple caching and uses GET requests that could additionally be cached through a service-worker.

### Servers / React

*   [apollo-server (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-server) - Spec-compliant and production ready JavaScript GraphQL server that lets you develop in a schema-first way. Built for Express, Connect, Hapi, Koa, and more.
*   [hapi-graphql (‚≠ê113)](https://github.com/SimonDegraeve/hapi-graphql) - Create a GraphQL HTTP server with Hapi.
*   [hapi-plugin-graphiql (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/rse/hapi-plugin-graphiql) - HAPI plugin for GraphiQL integration.
*   [graphql-api-koa (‚≠ê52)](https://github.com/jaydenseric/graphql-api-koa) - GraphQL Koa middleware that implements GraphQL.js from scratch and supports native ESM.
*   [koa-graphql (‚≠ê842)](https://github.com/chentsulin/koa-graphql) - GraphQL Koa Middleware.
*   [graphql-koa-scripts (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/ryanhs/graphql-koa-scripts) - GraphQL Koa 1 file simplified. usefull for quick test
*   [gql (‚≠ê198)](https://github.com/deno-libs/gql) - Universal GraphQL HTTP middleware for Deno.
*   [mercurius (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/mercurius-js/mercurius) - GraphQL plugin for Fastify.
*   [graphql-yoga (‚≠ê8.4k)](https://github.com/prisma-labs/graphql-yoga) - Fully-featured GraphQL Server with focus on easy setup, performance and great developer experience.
*   [graphitejs (‚≠ê121)](https://github.com/graphitejs/server) - Framework NodeJS for GraphQL.
*   [graphql-helix (‚≠ê829)](https://github.com/contrawork/graphql-helix) - A highly evolved GraphQL HTTP Server.

### Databases & ORMs / React

*   [graphql-sequelize (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/mickhansen/graphql-sequelize) - Sequelize helpers for GraphQL.
*   [graphql-bookshelf (‚≠ê184)](https://github.com/brysgo/graphql-bookshelf) - Some help defining GraphQL schema around BookshelfJS models.
*   [join-monster (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/acarl005/join-monster) - A GraphQL-to-SQL query execution layer for batch data fetching.

### PubSub / React

*   [graphql-ably-pubsub](https://www.npmjs.com/package/graphql-ably-pubsub) - Ably PubSub implementation for GraphQL to publish mutation updates and subscribe to the result through a subscription query.

### Custom Scalars / React

*   [graphql-scalars (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/Urigo/graphql-scalars) - A library of custom GraphQL Scalars for creating precise type-safe GraphQL schemas.
*   [graphql-java-datetime (‚≠ê149)](https://github.com/donbeave/graphql-java-datetime) - GraphQL ISO Date is a set of RFC 3339 compliant date/time scalar types to be used with graphql-java.
*   [graphql-java-extended-scalars (‚≠ê273)](https://github.com/graphql-java/graphql-java-extended-scalars) - Extended scalars for graphql-java.

### Type / React

*   [type-graphql (‚≠ê8.1k)](https://github.com/19majkel94/type-graphql) - Create GraphQL schema and resolvers with TypeScript, using classes and decorators!
*   [graphql-nexus (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/graphql-nexus/nexus) - Code-First, Type-Safe, GraphQL Schema Construction.

### Tools - Miscellaneous / React

*   [graphql-code-generator (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/dotansimha/graphql-code-generator) - GraphQL code generator based on schema and documents.
*   [swagger-to-graphql (‚≠ê923)](https://github.com/yarax/swagger-to-graphql) - GraphQL types builder based on REST API described in Swagger. Allows to migrate to GraphQL from REST for 5 minutes
*   [ts-graphql-plugin (‚≠ê744)](https://github.com/Quramy/ts-graphql-plugin) - A language service plugin complete and validate GraphQL query in TypeScript template strings.
*   [apollo-tracing (‚≠ê479)](https://github.com/apollographql/apollo-tracing) - GraphQL extension that enables you to easily get resolver-level performance information as part of a GraphQL response.
*   [json-graphql-server (‚≠ê1.9k)](https://github.com/marmelab/json-graphql-server) - Get a full fake GraphQL API with zero coding in less than 30 seconds, based on a JSON data file.
*   [Prisma (‚≠ê43k)](https://github.com/prisma/prisma) - Turn your database into a GraphQL API. Prisma lets you design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
*   [tuql (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/bradleyboy/tuql) - Automatically create a GraphQL server from any sqlite database.
*   [Bit (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/teambit/bit) - Organize GraphQL API as components to be consumed with NPM or modified from any project, [example-explanation](https://hackernoon.com/make-your-graphql-api-easier-to-adopt-through-components-74b022f195c1)).
*   [openapi-to-graphql (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/ibm/openapi-to-graphql) - Take any OpenAPI Specification (OAS) or swagger and create a GraphQL interface - Two minute video and resources [here](https://developer.ibm.com/open/projects/openapi-to-graphql/)
*   [Retool](https://retool.com/) ‚Äì Internal tools builder on top of your GraphQL APIs + GraphQL IDE with a schema explorer.
*   [dataloader-codegen (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/Yelp/dataloader-codegen) - An opinionated JavaScript library for automatically generating predictable, type safe DataLoaders over a set of resources (e.g. HTTP endpoints).
*   [raphql-inspector (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/graphql-inspector): alidate schema, get schema change notifications, validate operations, find breaking changes, look for similar types, schema coverage.

### Miscellaneous / React

*   [graphql-tools (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/apollographql/graphql-tools) - Tool library for building and maintaining GraphQL-JS servers.
*   [graphql-tag (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/apollographql/graphql-tag) - A JavaScript template literal tag that parses GraphQL queries.
*   [graphql-compose (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/graphql-compose/graphql-compose) - Tool which allows you to construct flexible graphql schema from different data sources via plugins.
*   [graphql-modules (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/Urigo/graphql-modules) - Separate GraphQL server into smaller, reusable parts by modules or features.
*   [graphql-shield (‚≠ê3.6k)](https://github.com/maticzav/graphql-shield) - A library that helps creating a permission layer for a graphql api.
*   [graphql-let (‚≠ê455)](https://github.com/piglovesyou/graphql-let) - A webpack loader to import type-protected codegen results directly from GraphQL documents
*   [graphql-config (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/kamilkisiela/graphql-config) - One configuration for all your GraphQL tools (supported by most tools, editors & IDEs).
*   [graphql-cli (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/urigo/graphql-cli) - A command line tool for common GraphQL development workflows.
*   [graphql-toolkit (‚≠ê168)](https://github.com/ardatan/graphql-toolkit) - A set of utils for faster development of GraphQL tools (Schema and documents loading, Schema merging and more).
*   [graphql-mesh (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/urigo/graphql-mesh) - use GraphQL query language to access data in remote APIs that don't run GraphQL (and also ones that do run GraphQL).
*   [sofa (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/Urigo/sofa) - Generate REST API from your GraphQL API.
*   [graphback (‚≠ê409)](https://github.com/aerogear/graphback) - Framework and CLI to add a GraphQLCRUD API layer to a GraphQL server using data models.
*   [graphql-middleware (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/maticzav/graphql-middleware) - Split up your GraphQL resolvers in middleware functions.
*   [graphql-relay-js (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/graphql/graphql-relay-js) - A library to help construct a graphql-js server supporting react-relay.
*   [graphql-normalizr (‚≠ê195)](https://github.com/monojack/graphql-normalizr) - Normalize GraphQL responses for persisting in the client cache/state.
*   [babel-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/ooflorent/babel-plugin-graphql) - Babel plugin that compile GraphQL tagged template strings.
*   [eslint-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/apollographql/eslint-plugin-graphql) - An ESLint plugin that checks your GraphQL strings against a schema.
*   [graphql-ws (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/enisdenjo/graphql-ws) - Coherent, zero-dependency, lazy, simple, GraphQL over WebSocket Protocol compliant server and client.
*   [graphql-live-query (‚≠ê437)](https://github.com/n1ru4l/graphql-live-query) - Realtime GraphQL Live Queries with JavaScript.
*   [GraphVinci (‚≠ê77)](https://github.com/Comcast/graphvinci) - An interactive schema visualizer for GraphQL APIs.

### JavaScript Examples / React

*   [React Starter Kit (‚≠ê23k)](https://github.com/kriasoft/react-starter-kit) - front-end starter kit using React, Relay, GraphQL, and JAM stack architecture.
*   [SWAPI GraphQL Wrapper (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/graphql/swapi-graphql) - A GraphQL schema and server wrapping SWAPI.
*   [Relay TodoMVC (‚≠ê158)](https://github.com/taion/relay-todomvc) - Relay TodoMVC with routing.
*   [Apollo Server tools documentation](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/apollo-server/) - Documentation, tutorial and examples for building GraphQL server and connecting to SQL, MongoDB and REST endpoints.
*   [F8 App 2017 (‚≠ê14k)](https://github.com/fbsamples/f8app) - Source code of the official F8 app of 2016, powered by React Native and other Facebook open source projects.
*   [Apollo React example for Github GraphQL API (‚≠ê114)](https://github.com/katopz/react-apollo-graphql-github-example) - Usage Examples Apollo React for Github GraphQL API with create-react-app.
*   [Next.js TypeScript and GraphQL Example (‚≠ê133k)](https://github.com/zeit/next.js/tree/canary/examples/with-typescript-graphql) - A type-protected GraphQL example on Next.js running [graphql-codegen](https://graphql-code-generator.com/) under the hood
*   [GraphQL StackBlitz Starter](https://stackblitz.com/fork/graphql) ‚Äì A live, editable demo spinning up in about 2 seconds and running in a browser.
*   [NAPERG (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/alan345/naperg) - Fullstack Boilerplate GraphQL. Made with React & Prisma + authentication & roles.
*   [VulcanJS](http://vulcanjs.org) - The full-stack React+GraphQL framework
*   [RAN Toolkit (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/sly777/ran) - Production-ready toolkit/boilerplate with support for GraphQL, SSR, Hot-reload, CSS-in-JS, caching, and more.

### TypeScript Examples / React

*   [Node.js API Starter (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/kriasoft/nodejs-api-starter) - Yarn v2 based monorepo template (code-first GraphQL API, PostgreSQL, PnP, Zero-install, serverless).
*   [Next.js Apollo TypeScript Starter (‚≠ê273)](https://github.com/borisowsky/nextjs-apollo-ts-starter) - Next.js starter project focused on developer experience.
*   [GraphQL Starter (‚≠ê112)](https://github.com/cerino-ligutom/GraphQL-Starter) - A boilerplate for TypeScript + Node Express + Apollo GraphQL APIs.

### Ruby / React

*   [graphql-ruby (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/rmosolgo/graphql-ruby) - Ruby implementation of Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [graphql-batch (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/Shopify/graphql-batch) - A query batching executor for the graphql gem.
*   [graphql-auth (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/o2web/graphql-auth) - A JWT auth wrapper working with devise.
*   [agoo (‚≠ê918)](https://github.com/ohler55/agoo) - Ruby web server that implements Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [GQLi (‚≠ê209)](https://github.com/contentful-labs/gqli.rb) - A GraphQL client and DSL. Allowing to write queries in native Ruby.

### Ruby Examples / React

*   [graphql-ruby-demo (‚≠ê218)](https://github.com/rmosolgo/graphql-ruby-demo) - Use graphql-ruby to expose a Rails app.
*   [github-graphql-rails-example (‚≠ê279)](https://github.com/github/github-graphql-rails-example) - Example Rails app using GitHub's GraphQL API.
*   [relay-on-rails (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/nethsix/relay-on-rails) - Barebones starter kit for Relay application with Rails GraphQL server.
*   [relay-rails-blog (‚≠ê140)](https://github.com/gauravtiwari/relay-rails-blog) - A graphql, relay and standard rails application powered demo weblog.
*   [to\_eat\_app (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/jcdavison/to_eat_app) - A sample graphql/rails/relay application with a related 3-part article series.
*   [agoo-demo (‚≠ê918)](https://github.com/ohler55/agoo/tree/develop/example/graphql) - Use of the Agoo server to demonstrate a simple GraphQL application.
*   [rails-devise-graphql (‚≠ê286)](https://github.com/zauberware/rails-devise-graphql) - A rails 6 boilerplate with devise, graphql & JWT auth.

### PHP / React

*   [graphql-php (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/webonyx/graphql-php) - A PHP port of GraphQL reference implementation.
*   [graphql-relay-php (‚≠ê271)](https://github.com/ivome/graphql-relay-php) - Relay helpers for webonyx/graphql-php implementation of GraphQL.
*   [lighthouse (‚≠ê3.4k)](https://github.com/nuwave/lighthouse) - A PHP package that allows to serve a GraphQL endpoint from your Laravel application.
*   [graphql-laravel (‚≠ê2.2k)](https://github.com/rebing/graphql-laravel) - Laravel wrapper for Facebook's GraphQL.
*   [overblog/graphql-bundle (‚≠ê791)](https://github.com/overblog/GraphQLBundle) - This bundle provides tools to build a complete GraphQL server in your Symfony App. Supports react-relay.

Specifications

  • GraphQL (‚≠ê14k) - Working draft of the specification for GraphQL.
  • GraphQL over HTTP (‚≠ê414) - Working draft of "GraphQL over HTTP" specification.
  • GraphQL Relay - Relay-compliant GraphQL server specification.
  • OpenCRUD (‚≠ê388) - OpenCRUD is a GraphQL CRUD API specification for databases.
  • Apollo Federation - Apollo Federation specification

Foundations

  • GraphQL Foundation - GraphQL Foundation under the Linux Foundation

Communities

  • Facebook - Group for discussions, articles and knowledge sharing.
  • StackOverflow - Questions and answers. Use the tag graphql.
  • GraphQL APIs (‚≠ê4.6k) - A collective list of public GraphQL APIs.

Meetups

  • Relay Meetup - A global, online meetup on Relay, the GraphQL client.
  • Amsterdam
  • Bangalore
  • Berlin
  • Buenos Aires
  • Copenhagen
  • Dallas-Fort Worth
  • Hamburg
  • London
  • Melbourne
  • Munich
  • New York City
  • San Francisco
  • Seattle
  • Sydney
  • Tel Aviv
  • Wroc≈Çaw
  • Singapore
  • Zurich

JavaScript/TypeScript

  • graphql-js (‚≠ê20k) - A reference implementation of GraphQL for JavaScript.
  • graphql-jit (‚≠ê1.1k) - GraphQL execution using a JIT compiler.

Clients

  • apollo-client (‚≠ê20k) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for every UI framework and GraphQL server.
  • graphql-request (‚≠ê6k) - A minimal GraphQL client for Node and browsers.
  • typescript-graphql-request - Use GraphQL Request as a fully typed SDK.
  • graphql-zeus (‚≠ê2k) - GraphQL Zeus creates autocomplete client library for JavaScript or TypeScript which provides autocompletion for strongly typed queries.
  • graphqurl (‚≠ê3.4k) - curl for GraphQL with autocomplete, subscriptions and GraphiQL. Also a dead-simple universal javascript GraphQL client.
  • aws-amplify (‚≠ê9.5k) - A client library developed by Amazon for caching, analytics and more that includes a way to fetch GraphQL queries.

Frontend Framework Integrations

  • vue-apollo (‚≠ê6.1k) - Apollo/GraphQL integration for VueJS.
  • apollo-angular (‚≠ê1.5k) - A fully-featured, production ready caching GraphQL client for Angular and every GraphQL server.
  • svelte-apollo (‚≠ê949) - Svelte integration for Apollo GraphQL.
  • ember-apollo-client (‚≠ê280) - An ember-cli addon for Apollo Client and GraphQL.
  • apollo-elements (‚≠ê420) - GraphQL web components that work in any frontend framework.

Frontend Framework Integrations / React

  • react-apollo - The core @apollo/client library provides built-in integration with React.
  • relay (‚≠ê19k) - Relay is a JavaScript framework for building data-driven React applications.
  • urql (‚≠ê8.8k) - A simple caching GraphQL client for React.
  • graphql-hooks (‚≠ê1.9k) - Minimal hooks-first GraphQL client with caching and server-side rendering support.
  • mst-gql (‚≠ê688) - Bindings for mobx-state-tree and GraphQL.
  • micro-graphql-react (‚≠ê532) - A lightweight utility for adding GraphQL to React. components. Includes simple caching and uses GET requests that could additionally be cached through a service-worker.

Servers / React

  • apollo-server (‚≠ê14k) - Spec-compliant and production ready JavaScript GraphQL server that lets you develop in a schema-first way. Built for Express, Connect, Hapi, Koa, and more.
  • hapi-graphql (‚≠ê113) - Create a GraphQL HTTP server with Hapi.
  • hapi-plugin-graphiql (‚≠ê21) - HAPI plugin for GraphiQL integration.
  • graphql-api-koa (‚≠ê52) - GraphQL Koa middleware that implements GraphQL.js from scratch and supports native ESM.
  • koa-graphql (‚≠ê842) - GraphQL Koa Middleware.
  • graphql-koa-scripts (‚≠ê2) - GraphQL Koa 1 file simplified. usefull for quick test
  • gql (‚≠ê198) - Universal GraphQL HTTP middleware for Deno.
  • mercurius (‚≠ê2.4k) - GraphQL plugin for Fastify.
  • graphql-yoga (‚≠ê8.4k) - Fully-featured GraphQL Server with focus on easy setup, performance and great developer experience.
  • graphitejs (‚≠ê121) - Framework NodeJS for GraphQL.
  • graphql-helix (‚≠ê829) - A highly evolved GraphQL HTTP Server.

Databases & ORMs / React

  • graphql-sequelize (‚≠ê1.9k) - Sequelize helpers for GraphQL.
  • graphql-bookshelf (‚≠ê184) - Some help defining GraphQL schema around BookshelfJS models.
  • join-monster (‚≠ê2.7k) - A GraphQL-to-SQL query execution layer for batch data fetching.

PubSub / React

  • graphql-ably-pubsub - Ably PubSub implementation for GraphQL to publish mutation updates and subscribe to the result through a subscription query.

Custom Scalars / React

  • graphql-scalars (‚≠ê1.9k) - A library of custom GraphQL Scalars for creating precise type-safe GraphQL schemas.
  • graphql-java-datetime (‚≠ê149) - GraphQL ISO Date is a set of RFC 3339 compliant date/time scalar types to be used with graphql-java.
  • graphql-java-extended-scalars (‚≠ê273) - Extended scalars for graphql-java.

Type / React

  • type-graphql (‚≠ê8.1k) - Create GraphQL schema and resolvers with TypeScript, using classes and decorators!
  • graphql-nexus (‚≠ê3.4k) - Code-First, Type-Safe, GraphQL Schema Construction.

Tools - Miscellaneous / React

  • graphql-code-generator (‚≠ê11k) - GraphQL code generator based on schema and documents.
  • swagger-to-graphql (‚≠ê923) - GraphQL types builder based on REST API described in Swagger. Allows to migrate to GraphQL from REST for 5 minutes
  • ts-graphql-plugin (‚≠ê744) - A language service plugin complete and validate GraphQL query in TypeScript template strings.
  • apollo-tracing (‚≠ê479) - GraphQL extension that enables you to easily get resolver-level performance information as part of a GraphQL response.
  • json-graphql-server (‚≠ê1.9k) - Get a full fake GraphQL API with zero coding in less than 30 seconds, based on a JSON data file.
  • Prisma (‚≠ê43k) - Turn your database into a GraphQL API. Prisma lets you design your data model and have a production ready GraphQL API online in minutes.
  • tuql (‚≠ê1.1k) - Automatically create a GraphQL server from any sqlite database.
  • Bit (‚≠ê18k) - Organize GraphQL API as components to be consumed with NPM or modified from any project, example-explanation).
  • openapi-to-graphql (‚≠ê1.6k) - Take any OpenAPI Specification (OAS) or swagger and create a GraphQL interface - Two minute video and resources here
  • Retool ‚Äì Internal tools builder on top of your GraphQL APIs + GraphQL IDE with a schema explorer.
  • dataloader-codegen (‚≠ê115) - An opinionated JavaScript library for automatically generating predictable, type safe DataLoaders over a set of resources (e.g. HTTP endpoints).
  • raphql-inspector (‚≠ê1.7k): alidate schema, get schema change notifications, validate operations, find breaking changes, look for similar types, schema coverage.

Miscellaneous / React

  • graphql-tools (‚≠ê5.4k) - Tool library for building and maintaining GraphQL-JS servers.
  • graphql-tag (‚≠ê2.3k) - A JavaScript template literal tag that parses GraphQL queries.
  • graphql-compose (‚≠ê1.2k) - Tool which allows you to construct flexible graphql schema from different data sources via plugins.
  • graphql-modules (‚≠ê1.3k) - Separate GraphQL server into smaller, reusable parts by modules or features.
  • graphql-shield (‚≠ê3.6k) - A library that helps creating a permission layer for a graphql api.
  • graphql-let (‚≠ê455) - A webpack loader to import type-protected codegen results directly from GraphQL documents
  • graphql-config (‚≠ê1.2k) - One configuration for all your GraphQL tools (supported by most tools, editors & IDEs).
  • graphql-cli (‚≠ê2k) - A command line tool for common GraphQL development workflows.
  • graphql-toolkit (‚≠ê168) - A set of utils for faster development of GraphQL tools (Schema and documents loading, Schema merging and more).
  • graphql-mesh (‚≠ê3.4k) - use GraphQL query language to access data in remote APIs that don't run GraphQL (and also ones that do run GraphQL).
  • sofa (‚≠ê1.1k) - Generate REST API from your GraphQL API.
  • graphback (‚≠ê409) - Framework and CLI to add a GraphQLCRUD API layer to a GraphQL server using data models.
  • graphql-middleware (‚≠ê1.1k) - Split up your GraphQL resolvers in middleware functions.
  • graphql-relay-js (‚≠ê1.5k) - A library to help construct a graphql-js server supporting react-relay.
  • graphql-normalizr (‚≠ê195) - Normalize GraphQL responses for persisting in the client cache/state.
  • babel-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê64) - Babel plugin that compile GraphQL tagged template strings.
  • eslint-plugin-graphql (‚≠ê1.2k) - An ESLint plugin that checks your GraphQL strings against a schema.
  • graphql-ws (‚≠ê1.8k) - Coherent, zero-dependency, lazy, simple, GraphQL over WebSocket Protocol compliant server and client.
  • graphql-live-query (‚≠ê437) - Realtime GraphQL Live Queries with JavaScript.
  • GraphVinci (‚≠ê77) - An interactive schema visualizer for GraphQL APIs.

JavaScript Examples / React

  • React Starter Kit (‚≠ê23k) - front-end starter kit using React, Relay, GraphQL, and JAM stack architecture.
  • SWAPI GraphQL Wrapper (‚≠ê1.1k) - A GraphQL schema and server wrapping SWAPI.
  • Relay TodoMVC (‚≠ê158) - Relay TodoMVC with routing.
  • Apollo Server tools documentation - Documentation, tutorial and examples for building GraphQL server and connecting to SQL, MongoDB and REST endpoints.
  • F8 App 2017 (‚≠ê14k) - Source code of the official F8 app of 2016, powered by React Native and other Facebook open source projects.
  • Apollo React example for Github GraphQL API (‚≠ê114) - Usage Examples Apollo React for Github GraphQL API with create-react-app.
  • Next.js TypeScript and GraphQL Example (‚≠ê133k) - A type-protected GraphQL example on Next.js running graphql-codegen under the hood
  • GraphQL StackBlitz Starter ‚Äì A live, editable demo spinning up in about 2 seconds and running in a browser.
  • NAPERG (‚≠ê1.2k) - Fullstack Boilerplate GraphQL. Made with React & Prisma + authentication & roles.
  • VulcanJS - The full-stack React+GraphQL framework
  • RAN Toolkit (‚≠ê2.2k) - Production-ready toolkit/boilerplate with support for GraphQL, SSR, Hot-reload, CSS-in-JS, caching, and more.

TypeScript Examples / React

  • Node.js API Starter (‚≠ê4k) - Yarn v2 based monorepo template (code-first GraphQL API, PostgreSQL, PnP, Zero-install, serverless).
  • Next.js Apollo TypeScript Starter (‚≠ê273) - Next.js starter project focused on developer experience.
  • GraphQL Starter (‚≠ê112) - A boilerplate for TypeScript + Node Express + Apollo GraphQL APIs.

Ruby / React

  • graphql-ruby (‚≠ê5.4k) - Ruby implementation of Facebook's GraphQL.
  • graphql-batch (‚≠ê1.4k) - A query batching executor for the graphql gem.
  • graphql-auth (‚≠ê26) - A JWT auth wrapper working with devise.
  • agoo (‚≠ê918) - Ruby web server that implements Facebook's GraphQL.
  • GQLi (‚≠ê209) - A GraphQL client and DSL. Allowing to write queries in native Ruby.

Ruby Examples / React

  • graphql-ruby-demo (‚≠ê218) - Use graphql-ruby to expose a Rails app.
  • github-graphql-rails-example (‚≠ê279) - Example Rails app using GitHub's GraphQL API.
  • relay-on-rails (‚≠ê43) - Barebones starter kit for Relay application with Rails GraphQL server.
  • relay-rails-blog (‚≠ê140) - A graphql, relay and standard rails application powered demo weblog.
  • to_eat_app (‚≠ê13) - A sample graphql/rails/relay application with a related 3-part article series.
  • agoo-demo (‚≠ê918) - Use of the Agoo server to demonstrate a simple GraphQL application.
  • rails-devise-graphql (‚≠ê286) - A rails 6 boilerplate with devise, graphql & JWT auth.

PHP / React

  • graphql-php (‚≠ê4.7k) - A PHP port of GraphQL reference implementation.
  • graphql-relay-php (‚≠ê271) - Relay helpers for webonyx/graphql-php implementation of GraphQL.
  • lighthouse (‚≠ê3.4k) - A PHP package that allows to serve a GraphQL endpoint from your Laravel application.
  • graphql-laravel (‚≠ê2.2k) - Laravel wrapper for Facebook's GraphQL.
  • overblog/graphql-bundle (‚≠ê791) - This bundle provides tools to build a complete GraphQL server in your Symfony App. Supports react-relay.
  • wp-graphql (‚≠ê3.7k) - GraphQL API for WordPress.
  • graphqlite (‚≠ê561) - Framework agnostic library that allows you to write GraphQL server by annotating your PHP classes.
  • siler (‚≠ê1.1k) - Plain-old functions providing a declarative API for GraphQL servers with Subscriptions support.
  • graphql-request-builder (‚≠ê4) - Builds request payload in GraphQL structure.

PHP Examples / React

  • siler-graphgl (‚≠ê1.1k) - An example GraphQL server written with Siler.

Python / React

  • graphql-parser (‚≠ê46) - GraphQL parser for Python.
  • graphql-relay-py (‚≠ê143) - A library to help construct a graphql-py server supporting react-relay.
  • graphql-parser-python (‚≠ê4) - A python wrapper around libgraphqlparser.
  • graphene (‚≠ê8.2k) - A package for creating GraphQL schemas/types in a Pythonic easy way.
  • graphene-gae (‚≠ê117) - Adds GraphQL support to Google AppEngine (GAE).
  • django-graphiql (‚≠ê35) - Integrate GraphiQL easily into your Django project.
  • flask-graphql (‚≠ê1.3k) - Adds GraphQL support to your Flask application.
  • python-graphql-client (‚≠ê155) - Simple GraphQL client for Python 2.7+
  • python-graphjoiner (‚≠ê2) - Create GraphQL APIs using joins, SQL or otherwise.
  • graphene-django (‚≠ê4.4k) - A Django integration for Graphene.
  • Flask-GraphQL-Auth (‚≠ê63) - An authentication library for Flask inspired from flask-jwt-extended.
  • tartiflette (‚≠ê858) - GraphQL Implementation, SDL First, for python 3.6+ / asyncio.
  • tartiflette-aiohttp (‚≠ê61) - Wrapper of Tartiflette to expose GraphQL API over HTTP based on aiohttp / 3.6+ / asyncio, official tutorial available on tartiflette.io.
  • Ariadne (‚≠ê2.3k) - library for implementing GraphQL servers using schema-first approach. Asynchronous query execution, batteries included for ASGI, WSGI and popular webframeworks, fully documented.
  • django-graphql-auth (‚≠ê333) - Django registration and authentication with GraphQL.
  • strawberry (‚≠ê4.3k) - A new GraphQL library for Python.

Python Examples / React

  • swapi-graphene (‚≠ê174) - A GraphQL schema and server using Graphene.

Java / React

  • graphql-java (‚≠ê6.2k) - GraphQL Java implementation.
  • DGS Framework (‚≠ê3.2k) - A GraphQL server framework for Spring Boot, developed by Netflix.
  • graphql-java-generator - A Maven plugin (‚≠ê122) and a Gradle plugin (‚≠ê55) that can generate both the Client and the Server (POJOs and utility classes). The server part is based on graphql-java, and hides all its boilerplate codes.
  • gaphql-java-type-generator (‚≠ê35) - Auto-generates types for use with GraphQL Java
  • schemagen-graphql (‚≠ê48) - Schema generation and execution package that turns POJO's into a GraphQL Java queryable set of objects. Enables exposing any service as a GraphQL service using Annotations.
  • graphql-java-annotations (‚≠ê388) - Provides annotations-based syntax for schema definition with GraphQL Java.
  • graphql-java-tools (‚≠ê815) - Schema-first graphql-java convenience library that makes it easy to bring your own implementations as data resolvers. Inspired by graphql-tools (‚≠ê5.4k) for JS.
  • graphql-java-codegen-maven-plugin (‚≠ê17) - Schema-first maven plugin for generating Java types and Resolver interfaces. Works perfectly in conjunction with graphql-java-tools. Inspired by swagger-codegen-maven-plugin (‚≠ê17k).
  • graphql-java-codegen-gradle-plugin (‚≠ê19) - Schema-first gradle plugin for generating Java types and Resolver interfaces. Works perfectly in conjunction with graphql-java-tools. Inspired by gradle-swagger-generator-plugin (‚≠ê309).
  • graphql-java-servlet (‚≠ê222) - A framework-agnostic java servlet for exposing graphql-java query endpoints with GET, POST, and multipart uploads.
  • manifold-graphql (‚≠ê2.6k) - Comprehensive GraphQL client use. Schema-first. Type-safe GraphQL types, queries, and results, no code generators, no POJOs, no annotations. Excellent IDE support with IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio. See the Java example below.
  • spring-graphql-common (‚≠ê134) - Spring Framework GraphQL Library.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Abduction / Explanation

*   [Use of current explanations in multicausal abductive reasoning](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1207/s15516709cog2506_2) - ***Cognitive Science***, 2001. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=7816050625957759346\&hl=en\&as_sdt=2005\&sciodt=0,5)].
*   [Abduction: A categorical characterization](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1570868314000895) - ***Journal of Applied Logic***, 2015. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=17834260152484836885\&hl=en\&as_sdt=2005\&sciodt=0,5)].
*   [Defending Abduction](https://www.journals.uchicago.edu/doi/abs/10.1086/392744) - ***Philosophy of Science***, 1999. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=13895790050138832555\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Abduction‚Äâ‚àí‚Äâthe context of discovery‚Äâ+‚Äâunderdetermination‚Äâ=‚Äâinference to the best explanation](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11229-019-02337-z) - ***Synthese***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=4261649938116694095\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Towards an Architecture for Cognitive Vision Using Qualitative Spatio-temporal Representations and Abduction](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007%2F3-540-45004-1_14) - ***Spatial Cognition***, 2002. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=8072265283930278310\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Abductive inference within a pragmatic framework](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11229-018-1824-6) - ***Synthese***, 2018. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=10285954503043361393\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Disjunctive Abduction](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s00354-019-00059-x) - ***New Generation Computing***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=6664745483675209831\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [The order effect in human abductive reasoning: an empirical and computational study](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/09528130600558141?scroll=top\&needAccess=true) - ***Journal of Experimental & Theoretical Artificial Intelligence***, 2006. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=3803536062463585043\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [The AHA! Experience: Creativity Through Emergent Binding in Neural Networks](https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/j.1551-6709.2010.01142.x) - ***Cognitive Science***, 2012. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=10006889101167052798\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Abduction / Scientific Discovery

*   [Hypothesis generation, sparse categories, and the positive test strategy](https://psycnet.apa.org/record/2010-22980-001) - ***Psychological Review***, 2011. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=4329636480235863472\&hl=en\&as_sdt=2005\&sciodt=0,5)].

### Bayesian Modeling / Nonparametric Model

*   [Learning Systems of Concepts with an Infinite Relational Model](https://www.aaai.org/Papers/AAAI/2006/AAAI06-061.pdf) - ***AAAI'06***, 2006. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=3207350432755252565\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [The nested chinese restaurant process and bayesian nonparametric inference of topic hierarchies](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/1667053.1667056) - ***Journal of the ACM***, 2010. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=8216933258869737505\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Susan Carey / Commonsense Knowledgebase

*   [Conceptual Change in Childhood](https://hk1lib.org/book/3659332/11fa44) - ***MIT Press***, 1985. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en\&as_sdt=0%2C5\&q=conceptual+change+in+childhood+susan+carey\&btnG=)].
*   [The Origin of Concepts](https://hk1lib.org/book/844457/42178f?id=844457\&secret=42178f) - ***Oxford University Press***, 2009. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=11493102398422813821\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Communications / Non-Verbal Communication

*   [The Picture Exchange Communication System](https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/abs/10.1177/108835769400900301) - ***Behavior Modification***, 1994. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=18113491434570143349\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [A multimodal discourse theory of visual narrative](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0378216614001830) - ***Journal of Pragmatics***, 2014. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=912273653379961242\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Communications / Pragmatics

*   [Information Structure in Discourse: Towards an Integrated Formal Theory of Pragmatics](https://semprag.org/index.php/sp/article/view/sp.5.6/pdf) - ***Semantics and Pragmatics***, 1998. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=9127222314768938599\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Communications / Language Compositionality

*   [Emergent communication through negotiation](https://arxiv.org/abs/1804.03980) - ***ICLR'18***, 2018. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=8825869866742501521\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [The language of generalization](https://psycnet.apa.org/record/2019-07481-001) - ***Psychological Review***, 2019. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=7723877614160376324\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].
*   [Compositionality and Generalization in Emergent Languages](https://arxiv.org/abs/2004.09124) - ***ACL'20***, 2020. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=5792073344743965767\&hl=en\&as_sdt=0,5)].

### Problem Solving / Human-Level Problem Solving

System 1 & System 2 / Neural-Symbolic AI

Embodied Intelligence / Explainable Deep Learning

Methodologies for Experiments / Human-Machine Comparison

Meta-Level Considerations / Gestalt

Meta-Level Considerations / Cognitive Architecture

Theory of Mind / AI Assisted Research

Analogy / AI Assisted Research

Causality / AI Assisted Research

Knowledge Representation / Commonsense Knowledgebase

Cognitive Development / Commonsense Knowledgebase

Learning in the Open World / Commonsense Knowledgebase

Ulf Grenander / Commonsense Knowledgebase

items.title: Awesome Capacitor
items.content_text:
### Official plugins

*   [Action Sheet (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/action-sheet) - Provides access to native Action Sheets.
*   [App Launcher (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/app-launcher) - Allows to check if an app can be opened and open it.
*   [Browser (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/browser) - Provides the ability to open an in-app browser and subscribe to browser events.
*   [Camera (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/camera) - Provides the ability to take a photo with the camera or choose an existing one from the photo album.
*   [Clipboard (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/clipboard) - Enables copy and pasting to/from the system clipboard.
*   [Dialog (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/dialog) - Provides methods for triggering native dialog windows for alerts, confirmations, and input prompts.
*   [Geolocation (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/geolocation) - Provides simple methods for getting and tracking the current position of the device using GPS, along with altitude, heading, and speed information if available.
*   [Haptics (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/haptics) - Provides physical feedback to the user through touch or vibration.
*   [Keyboard (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/keyboard) - Provides keyboard display and visibility control, along with event tracking when the keyboard shows and hides.
*   [Local Notifications (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/local-notifications) - Provides a way to schedule device notifications locally (i.e. without a server sending push notifications).
*   [Motion (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/motion) - Tracks accelerometer and device orientation (compass heading, etc.).
*   [Network (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/network) - Provides network and connectivity information.
*   [Push Notifications (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/push-notifications) - Provides access to native push notifications.
*   [Share (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/share) - Provides methods for sharing content in any sharing-enabled apps the user may have installed.
*   [Splash Screen (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/splash-screen) - Provides methods for showing or hiding a Splash image.
*   [Status Bar (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/status-bar) - Provides methods for configuring the style of the Status Bar, along with showing or hiding it.
*   [Text Zoom (‚≠ê601)](https://github.com/ionic-team/capacitor-plugins/tree/main/text-zoom) - Provides the ability to change Web View text size for visual accessibility.

### Community plugins

*   [Admob (‚≠ê247)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/admob) - A native plugin for AdMob.
*   [Apple sign in (‚≠ê157)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/apple-sign-in) - Capacitor Sign in with Apple.
*   [Background geolocation (‚≠ê219)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/background-geolocation) - Receive geolocation updates even while app is backgrounded.
*   [Barcode scanner (‚≠ê443)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/barcode-scanner) - A fast and efficient QR / barcode scanner for Capacitor.
*   [Bluetooth-le (‚≠ê325)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/bluetooth-le) - Bluetooth Low Energy.
*   [Camera preview (‚≠ê207)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/camera-preview) - Camera preview.
*   [Googlemaps (‚≠ê157)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/capacitor-googlemaps-native) - Plugin using native Maps API for Android and iOS.
*   [Contacts (‚≠ê139)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/contacts) - Contacts Plugin for Capacitor.
*   [Date picker (‚≠ê92)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/date-picker) - Native DateTime Picker Plugin for Capacitor Apps.
*   [Facebook Login (‚≠ê110)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/facebook-login) - A native plugin for Facebook Login.
*   [Flipper (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/flipper) - A native plugin for flipper debugger.
*   [Http (‚≠ê211)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/http) - A native HTTP plugin for CORS-free requests and file transfers.
*   [Intercom (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/intercom) - Enable Intercom features for Capacitor apps.
*   [Media (‚≠ê125)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/media) - Enable some media features for Capacitor such as create albums, save videos, gifs and more.
*   [Native audio (‚≠ê137)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/native-audio) - A native plugin for native audio engine.
*   [Native market (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/native-market) - A native market plugin for linking to google play or app store.
*   [React hooks (‚≠ê258)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/react-hooks) - React Hooks for Capacitor apps.
*   [Realm (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/realm) - A native plugin for MongoDB Realm.
*   [Speech recognition (‚≠ê109)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/speech-recognition) - A native plugin for speech recognition.
*   [Sqlite (‚≠ê579)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/sqlite) - Native & electron SQLite databases.
*   [Stripe (‚≠ê213)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/stripe) - Stripe SDK bindings for Capacitor Applications.
*   [Tauri (‚≠ê127)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/tauri) - Support for the Tauri platform.
*   [Text to speech (‚≠ê112)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/text-to-speech) - Synthesizing speech from text.
*   [Twitter (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/twitter) - Enable TwitterKit features for Capacitor.
*   [Uxcam (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/capacitor-community/uxcam) - UXCam and FullStory analytics. It uses UXCam for Android and iOS platforms and FullStory for Web/PWA.

### Other plugins

*   [App Tracking Transparency (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/mahnuh/capacitor-plugin-app-tracking-transparency) - Request user authorization to access app-related data for tracking the user or the device. iOS only.
*   [Brother Print (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/rdlabo-team/capacitor-brotherprint) - A native Brother Print SDK implementation for iOS & Android.
*   [Biometric (‚≠ê193)](https://github.com/epicshaggy/capacitor-native-biometric) - Use biometrics confirm device owner presence or authenticate users.
*   [Dark mode (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/micahlt/ionicCapacitorDarkMode) - Monitor the changes made to system's dark mode.
*   [Email composer (‚≠ê24)](https://github.com/EinfachHans/capacitor-email-composer) - Open a native E-Mail Composer within your Capacitor App.
*   [Facebook Analytics (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/SpellChucker/capacitor-plugin-facebook-analytics) - Facebook Analytics Plugin for Capacitor.
*   [File selector (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/hinddeep/capacitor-file-selector) - Select files form Android/iOS devices and the web.
*   [Jitsi (‚≠ê91)](https://github.com/calvinckho/capacitor-jitsi-meet) - Make video calls through the free, open-sourced Jitsi video platform.
*   [Lightsensor (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/Elvincth/capacitor-plugin-lightsensor) - Get the illuminance level on the device.
*   [Native settings (‚≠ê116)](https://github.com/RaphaelWoude/capacitor-native-settings) - Open native settings screens.
*   NativeScript
    *   [NativeScript Capacitor (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/NativeScript/capacitor) - Empower Capacitor with native APIs.
    *   [Augmented Reality (‚≠ê117)](https://github.com/EddyVerbruggen/nativescript-ar) - Add AR experiences.
*   [Navigation bar (‚≠ê79)](https://github.com/hugotomazi/navigation-bar) - Navigation Bar manipulation, hide/show.
*   [Rate app (‚≠ê191)](https://github.com/Nodonisko/capacitor-rate-app) - Let users rate your app using native rate app dialog for both Android and iOS.
*   [Read sms (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/Ayush-Rajniwal/cap-read-sms) - Read the user's SMS with their permission.
*   [Screenshot (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/ludufre/capacitor-screenshot) - Take a screenshot of the current view.
*   [Send intent (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/tavosansal/capacitor-plugin-send-intent) - Expose a listener in your JavaScript application for when another application sends data to your Capacitor application via the Android share menu or share sheet.
*   [Sentry (‚≠ê132)](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-capacitor) - Add Sentry error tracking and performance monitoring for Capacitor apps.
*   [Stripe terminal (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/eventOneHQ/capacitor-stripe-terminal) - Stripe Terminal Plugin for Capacitor.
*   [Sprig (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/crabbydavis/sprig) - All-in-one‚Äâ product research platform.
*   [Square Payments (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/jbrown0824/capacitor-square-payments) - Enable Square Payments for Capacitor.
*   [Sumup (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/rbedemann/capacitor-sumup-plugin) - SumUp Mobile SDK.

  • Status Bar (‚≠ê601) - Provides methods for configuring the style of the Status Bar, along with showing or hiding it.
  • Text Zoom (‚≠ê601) - Provides the ability to change Web View text size for visual accessibility.

Community plugins

  • Admob (‚≠ê247) - A native plugin for AdMob.
  • Apple sign in (‚≠ê157) - Capacitor Sign in with Apple.
  • Background geolocation (‚≠ê219) - Receive geolocation updates even while app is backgrounded.
  • Barcode scanner (‚≠ê443) - A fast and efficient QR / barcode scanner for Capacitor.
  • Bluetooth-le (‚≠ê325) - Bluetooth Low Energy.
  • Camera preview (‚≠ê207) - Camera preview.
  • Googlemaps (‚≠ê157) - Plugin using native Maps API for Android and iOS.
  • Contacts (‚≠ê139) - Contacts Plugin for Capacitor.
  • Date picker (‚≠ê92) - Native DateTime Picker Plugin for Capacitor Apps.
  • Facebook Login (‚≠ê110) - A native plugin for Facebook Login.
  • Flipper (‚≠ê12) - A native plugin for flipper debugger.
  • Http (‚≠ê211) - A native HTTP plugin for CORS-free requests and file transfers.
  • Intercom (‚≠ê66) - Enable Intercom features for Capacitor apps.
  • Media (‚≠ê125) - Enable some media features for Capacitor such as create albums, save videos, gifs and more.
  • Native audio (‚≠ê137) - A native plugin for native audio engine.
  • Native market (‚≠ê30) - A native market plugin for linking to google play or app store.
  • React hooks (‚≠ê258) - React Hooks for Capacitor apps.
  • Realm (‚≠ê26) - A native plugin for MongoDB Realm.
  • Speech recognition (‚≠ê109) - A native plugin for speech recognition.
  • Sqlite (‚≠ê579) - Native & electron SQLite databases.
  • Stripe (‚≠ê213) - Stripe SDK bindings for Capacitor Applications.
  • Tauri (‚≠ê127) - Support for the Tauri platform.
  • Text to speech (‚≠ê112) - Synthesizing speech from text.
  • Twitter (‚≠ê11) - Enable TwitterKit features for Capacitor.
  • Uxcam (‚≠ê5) - UXCam and FullStory analytics. It uses UXCam for Android and iOS platforms and FullStory for Web/PWA.

Other plugins

  • App Tracking Transparency (‚≠ê35) - Request user authorization to access app-related data for tracking the user or the device. iOS only.
  • Brother Print (‚≠ê21) - A native Brother Print SDK implementation for iOS & Android.
  • Biometric (‚≠ê193) - Use biometrics confirm device owner presence or authenticate users.
  • Dark mode (‚≠ê1) - Monitor the changes made to system's dark mode.
  • Email composer (‚≠ê24) - Open a native E-Mail Composer within your Capacitor App.
  • Facebook Analytics (‚≠ê5) - Facebook Analytics Plugin for Capacitor.
  • File selector (‚≠ê14) - Select files form Android/iOS devices and the web.
  • Jitsi (‚≠ê91) - Make video calls through the free, open-sourced Jitsi video platform.
  • Lightsensor (‚≠ê3) - Get the illuminance level on the device.
  • Native settings (‚≠ê116) - Open native settings screens.
  • NativeScript
    • NativeScript Capacitor (‚≠ê42) - Empower Capacitor with native APIs.
    • Augmented Reality (‚≠ê117) - Add AR experiences.
  • Navigation bar (‚≠ê79) - Navigation Bar manipulation, hide/show.
  • Rate app (‚≠ê191) - Let users rate your app using native rate app dialog for both Android and iOS.
  • Read sms (‚≠ê3) - Read the user's SMS with their permission.
  • Screenshot (‚≠ê18) - Take a screenshot of the current view.
  • Send intent (‚≠ê12) - Expose a listener in your JavaScript application for when another application sends data to your Capacitor application via the Android share menu or share sheet.
  • Sentry (‚≠ê132) - Add Sentry error tracking and performance monitoring for Capacitor apps.
  • Stripe terminal (‚≠ê30) - Stripe Terminal Plugin for Capacitor.
  • Sprig (‚≠ê0) - All-in-one‚Äâ product research platform.
  • Square Payments (‚≠ê2) - Enable Square Payments for Capacitor.
  • Sumup (‚≠ê4) - SumUp Mobile SDK.

items.title: Dive Into Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Tools you'll need / Cloud-based options

*   **[Binder](https://mybinder.org/) is Jupyter Notebook's official choice to [try JupyterLab](https://jupyter.org/try)**

### Explore another notebook / What just happened?

*   **[Jupyter's official Gallery of Interesting Jupyter Notebooks: Statistics, Machine Learning and Data Science (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter/wiki)** ([permalink (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/jupyter/jupyter/wiki/A-gallery-of-interesting-Jupyter-Notebooks/ae03c01ed25024aa06a4479ea600895d59b38bc4))

### Other courses / Take my tips with a grain of salt

*   There are more alternatives linked [at the bottom of this guide](#more-ways-to-dive-into-machine-learning)

### Supplement: Troubleshooting / Production, Deployment, [MLOps](https://ml-ops.org/)

*   [MLOps Stack Canvas](https://ml-ops.org/content/mlops-stack-canvas) at [ml-ops.org](https://ml-ops.org/)
*   **[EthicalML/awesome-artificial-intelligence-guidelines (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/EthicalML/awesome-artificial-intelligence-guidelines)**
*   **[EthicalML/awesome-production-machine-learning (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/EthicalML/awesome-production-machine-learning#privacy-preserving-machine-learning)**
*   **[visenger/awesome-ml-model-governance (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/visenger/Awesome-ML-Model-Governance)**
*   **[visenger/awesome-MLOps (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/visenger/awesome-mlops)**

    *   and maybe: [cl-neo4j (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/kraison/cl-neo4j) - a thin neo4j RESTFUL client interface.
